Reference

ggpack

The ggpack function provides the foundation of ggpackets, allowing the packing of ggplot layers into a list within the ggpacket class and handling argument passing with a familiar syntax.

ggpack()

Handling of argument passing to ggplots

Argument Handling

ggpackets handles much of the difficulty of passing arguments to specific layers within a collection of ggplot layers. To accomplish this, a set of aiding functions help to handle the way in which arguments are processed.

remove_by_prefix()

Filter arguments based on a prefix id

The ggpacket class

The ggpackets class handles the collection of ggplot layers as a list as well as provides methods for handling arithmetic with standard ggplot objects to seamlessly integrate with ggplot syntax.

ggpacket-class

A class for wrapping ggplot layers.

`+`(<ggpacket>,<ANY>) `+`(<NULL>,<ggpacket>) `+`(<gg>,<ggpacket>)

Primitive methods for adding ggpackets to various ggplot objects

`[`(<ggpacket>) `[[`(<ggpacket>)

Overload [ generic to index into ggcalls list

show(<ggpacket>)

Overload show method to show ggpacket

names(<ggpacket>) `names<-`(<ggpacket>)

Overload names method to print ggpacket ggcall list names

Included ggpackets

Prebuilt ggpackets for common functionality.

ggpk_decorators()

Wrapper for common decorators to package

Manipulating ggplot2 Aesthetics

ggpackets relies heavily on intercepting arguments passed through ggplot elements and handling the filtering of those arguments into the packed components. A large subset of the parameters can be aesthetic arguments to specify plot elements which require special attention and handling to ensure they are properly distributed to the packed ggplot layers.

allowed_aesthetics()

Get Geom allowed aesthetics

filter_aesthetics()

Filter aesthetics for Geom

remove_aesthetics()

Remove specific aesthetics from mapping

flatten_aesthetics_to_group()

Flatten aesthetics into group

add_eqv_aes()

Add equivalent aesthetics to vector

split_aes_from_dots()

Filter arguments into aesthetic and non-aesthetic

is_uneval()

Determine if an argument is an unevaluated expression
